beans.description:
Illustrates how to get the adaptor to "register" the fact that it is starting with a servlet. It registers a subset of system properties plus any additionalRegistrationProps.
Typically the url is a jsp that will store these props, thus enabling organisations which deploy openadaptor to maintain an inventory if it's use.
The distribution may contain embedded properties, these cannot be overwritten using system properties. This enables custom distributions to enforce core behaviour, such as registration.
The actual adaptor, simply reads stdin and writes to stdout.
Run it like this...
java org.openadaptor.spring.SpringAdaptor -config registration.xml -bean Adaptor -props registration.properties
